title: Cyber Hygiene Basics
description: Master essential digital hygiene habits to protect yourself online. Learn secure daily practices, threat awareness, and basic security measures.

achievements.title: Online Clean Freak
achievements.description: Master the basics of digital hygiene

content.introduction: Welcome to your journey towards better digital hygiene! Let's start by understanding the core concepts and why they matter in today's connected world.

options: Regular practices to maintain digital security and privacy
questions.correctAnswer: Regular practices to maintain digital security and privacy
questions.explanation: Digital hygiene involves all the regular practices and habits that help maintain your digital security and privacy, similar to how personal hygiene keeps you healthy.

questions.text: HTTPS websites are more secure than HTTP websites
questions.explanation: HTTPS encrypts data transmission between your browser and the website, making it more secure than unencrypted HTTP connections.

questions.text: It's safe to download files from any website that offers them
questions.explanation: Only download files from trusted sources to avoid malware. Unknown sources may distribute harmful software.

scenarios.situation: Your device is running slow and showing unexpected pop-ups. What should you do first?
options: Run a full system scan with your antivirus
Download a speed booster app from an ad
scenarios.explanation: Running a system scan helps identify potential malware causing these issues. Always use trusted security software for scans.

scenarios.situation: You receive a notification that a system update is available. What's the best action?
options: Wait a few months to install
Only install if your device stops working
scenarios.explanation: Regular system updates are crucial for security. They often contain important security patches and bug fixes.

content.introduction: Learn how to protect your valuable data through regular backups and proper storage practices.

options: Have 3 copies, on 2 different media types, with 1 copy offsite
Backup 3 times a day, 2 times a week, 1 time a month
Use 3 devices, 2 clouds, and 1 external drive
Backup data for 3 days, 2 weeks, and 1 month
questions.correctAnswer: Have 3 copies, on 2 different media types, with 1 copy offsite
questions.explanation: The 3-2-1 backup rule is a best practice that ensures your data survives various types of disasters.

title: Password & Account Protection
description: Master the art of secure password creation and management. Learn about two-factor authentication and advanced account security measures.

content.introduction: Learn the art of creating strong, memorable passwords that keep your accounts secure.

questions.text: Which of these passwords is the strongest?
questions.explanation: Long passphrases are more secure and easier to remember than complex short passwords. This example uses four random words, creating high entropy while remaining memorable.

title: Phishing & Social Defense
description: Learn to identify and protect against phishing attempts and social engineering tactics. Master the art of digital self-defense.

content.introduction: Learn to identify and protect against phishing attempts.

options: A cyber attack that tricks users into revealing sensitive information
A way to clean your computer
questions.correctAnswer: A cyber attack that tricks users into revealing sensitive information
questions.explanation: Phishing is a type of social engineering attack where attackers impersonate legitimate entities to trick users into revealing sensitive information.

scenarios.situation: You receive a call from someone claiming to be from tech support about your computer having a virus. What do you do?
options: Give them remote access to your computer
Provide your credit card for "security software"
Hang up and contact the company directly
scenarios.explanation: Always verify the identity of callers by contacting the company through official channels you trust.

scenarios.situation: A colleague sends an urgent email requesting sensitive company data. What should you do?
options: Verify the request through a different communication channel
scenarios.explanation: Verify unusual requests through a different channel (phone, in person) to prevent business email compromise attacks.

title: Data & Device Protection
description: Learn advanced techniques for protecting your personal data and devices. Master privacy settings, encryption, and malware defense.

achievements.title: Cyber Shield Guardian
achievements.description: Master of data and device protection

content.introduction: Learn about data privacy and how to protect your personal information.

options: Any information that can identify you
questions.correctAnswer: Any information that can identify you
questions.explanation: Personal data includes any information that can be used to identify you, directly or indirectly.

scenarios.situation: Your antivirus detects a suspicious file. What should you do?
options: Share the file to check if it's safe
scenarios.explanation: Quarantining allows for safe analysis while preventing potential damage. Always investigate suspicious files properly.

scenarios.situation: You notice your device is mining cryptocurrency without your permission. What's your first step?
scenarios.explanation: Disconnecting prevents the malware from communicating with its control servers and limits damage.

content.introduction: Learn about data encryption and how it protects your information from unauthorized access.

options: To protect data from unauthorized access
questions.correctAnswer: To protect data from unauthorized access
questions.explanation: Encryption converts data into a coded form that only authorized parties can access, ensuring confidentiality.
Any data that could be valuable to attackers or harmful if exposed should be encrypted.
